Hortan plains is one of the most visited place of mine. There is few different roads we can go there. Many select Ohiya and few select via Kalupahana. After you enter Hortain plains there is more than mini worlds end and worlds end to see. There is few beautiful streems and Bakers fall.
Me and wife visit Horton Plains on the way from Kandy to Hikkaduva  Very good natur park.   But lots of walking.

Some say you have to get up at 5am to do this walk.  The sensible logic is that it gets hot during the day and the damp air rising up at the lookout points condenses in to cloud by late morning and kills the view which you are there for, plus rain can come in the afternoons.  We have teenage children, so 5am was never going to happen.  We started walking at 10am.  The day was part sunny and with a slight breeze and we made it to Little Worlds End with a great view.  The Worlds End view, was cloudy when we got there, but within seconds had entirely cleared for pictures, and then gone again within another minute.  Lots of wildlife along the way, Monkeys hooting and displaying in the trees, coloured lizards / chameleons all over the place, lots of pretty birds and flowers.  Best to go clockwise so you reach the lookout places as early as you can, ref the cloud issue, and then take a leisurely walk down and around the valley and the stream, meanders and waterfalls along the way.  Worth a quick look at the basic museum near the ticket office, to understand the context of how the place has changed over the centuries, deforestation, elephant killing, the impact of invasive species (who would have through Trout could be a pest?), and even potato farming as recently as the 60s, before it was made in to a reserve.  Not cheap to enter the park, but worth it to keep and preserve the area.
See this place. It has a huge area of beauti. Feel the environment by walking there. It is cool place even in the day time.

Review Title: Good for a light hike of 2 to 3 hours on highland
Review Text: This is on a grass high land with some up and down, but overall it is easy hike. Very fresh air on highland and some good photo spot.
a beautiful place where i could take my time looking at the scenery, a lovely waterfall with a cozy viewing deck
This trail connects the major views in Horton Plains National park and is a moderate walk of 9 km taking about 2h20 to 3hours to complete.
This is meant to be generating water almost every season of the country, you reach this attraction during your Horton plains hike

If you like nature, and you have a few hrs to spare, then this walk is certainly a must. Expect it to take aprox 3hrs, as there's quite a lot to see and video(mobile). The walk is about 6miles long so  don't walk alone and make sure you have some form of sustenance.(food/liquid).......Enjoy.!!!

This is the trail that almost everybody does once they go to Horton Plains National Park. There are many highlights in the Trail. 1. Mini World's end. 2. Great World's end 3. Baker's falls 4. Chimini Pool 5. Endless beautiful landscapes :-)

The Chimney Pool is situated between Baker's Fall and the brick sign post at Y junction which had been mentioned earlier. This man made bund using granite has created a water mass in an elevation above the pool below and flows into the pool as a kind of a waterfall. The pool is in abundance with Kekatiya plants ( Aponogeton jacobsenii) which also can be seen in the stream running along side of the trail at some places.

While this seems to be what travelers visit, it should not be taken lightly.  What is involved, is a 14 km walk, mostly through rough trails on rocks, mud, and river beds.  I can't imagine what it would be like if the conditions were rainy or any more wet/ slippery!  I would not recommend it for young families or anyone that does not have appropriate footwear.  I did like some of the sites but spent most of the time watching my footing.  We were disappointed not to see any fauna, beyond the deer at the entrance.
This is a wonderful trail , you get to see very light green plants , blue mountains . Feels like you are passing through a piece of heaven.
This plain is a wonderful sight to walk and you tent to enjoy the beauty of mother nature. simply picture perfect! take time to dip you feet and feel the cold nature water. so refreshing

On A 4 route at 160 km from Colombo you get Kalupahana Junction.  From there you can take a cool walk to Horton Plains through Bambarakanda falls and bakers falls. Just remember to take enough water and food , other wise there is no place to buy them until you reach pattipola
